intro: Pimpinella saxifraga f. subovata, commonly known as the broad-leaved cow-wheat, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features ovate to broadly ovate leaves with a serrated margin, and its small white flowers are typically arranged in compound umbels. It thrives in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
